description: Multiple choice A/B/C/D format prompts. A maps to SPEECH, B/C/D map to NONSPEECH.

templates.text:
What is in this audio?
A) Human speech
B) Music
C) Noise/silence
D) Other sounds

Classify the dominant audio content:
A) Human voice/speech
B) Musical content
C) Environmental noise
D) Tones/beeps/clicks

Select the best description:
A) Spoken words or conversational speech
B) Instrumental or vocal music
C) Ambient noise or silence
D) Electronic tones or signals

Audio category:
A) Human vocal communication
B) Non-speech audio (music/tones)
C) Noise or silence
D) Unidentified sounds

What do you hear?
A) Person talking/speaking
B) Song or melody
C) Background noise
D) Beeps/clicks/other

Primary audio source:
A) Human speech (syllables, words, dialogue)
B) Music (instrumental or sung)
C) Natural or artificial noise
D) Silence or very quiet audio

Task: Audio classification. Choose one:
A) Speech detected
B) Music detected
C) Noise detected
D) Silence detected

Based on acoustic features, this audio contains:
A) Human vocal tract activity (formants, consonants)
B) Musical tones/harmony
C) Non-linguistic sounds
D) Minimal acoustic energy

Example: [beeping sound] â†’ D
Classify this new audio:
A) Human speech
B) Music
C) Noise
D) Other

Select the category that best fits:
A) Spoken language or vocalizations
B) Songs, melodies, or instruments
C) Wind, traffic, or ambient sounds
D) Electronic signals or silence

Conservative: Only choose A if very confident.
A) Clearly human speech
B) Possibly music
C) Possibly noise/silence
D) Uncertain/other

What type of audio is this?
A) Speech or voice
B) Musical content
C) Environmental audio
D) Synthetic tones or quiet
